title: How to Make a Vegan Pina Vocado

steps.headline: Peel and dice the avocado.
steps.description: You only need ½ an avocado for this smoothie, so cut it in half, allowing the knife to run along the large pit.

steps.headline: Twist and separate the avocado and place one half in a plastic bag.
steps.description: Place the bag in the refrigerator to stop the oxidation process (which turns the fruit brown). Remove the pit and discard.

steps.headline: Hold the other avocado half in the palm of your hand and run the knife down middle of the fruit lengthwise.
steps.description: Depending on the size of the avocado, make four to six long slits down the middle, stopping the cut when the knife hits the tough peel.

steps.headline: Run the knife down the other side of the avocado, sideways.
steps.description: You will essentially be creating small squares.

steps.headline: Peel the avocado peel outward and back to expose the inside slices.
steps.description: Gently allow the slices to fall off the peel. If the avocado does not drop out of the peel on its own, gently run your knife underneath the fruit and between the peel to dislodge it. Add to the blender.

steps.headline: Peel and dice 1 small banana and add it to the blender.
Make fresh orange juice.
steps.description: Juice enough oranges to make 1 1/3 cups of freshly squeeze orange juice (roughly 4 to 6 medium sized oranges). Pour into the blender.

steps.headline: Measure 1 ¼ cups of frozen fruit.
steps.description: Use fruit such as pineapple, blackberries, strawberries or even mixed berries. Add to the blender.

steps.headline: Combine all of the above prepared ingredients in the blender.
steps.description: Blend at high speed. Avoid over-blending as you may break down some of the ingredients and flavor.

steps.headline: Pour the drink into a tall glass.
steps.description: Top with a variety of ingredients such as ½ a lime squeezed over the top immediately before serving, 1 tablespoon of coconut milk drizzled over the top, or 2 teaspoons of unsweetened coconut flakes. For added kick, try a dash of cayenne pepper.

text: Preparing the Avocado Peel and dice the avocado. You only need ½ an avocado for this smoothie, so cut it in half, allowing the knife to run along the large pit. Twist and separate the avocado and place one half in a plastic bag. Place the bag in the refrigerator to stop the oxidation process (which turns the fruit brown). Remove the pit and discard. Hold the other avocado half in the palm of your hand and run the knife down middle of the fruit lengthwise. Depending on the size of the avocado, make four to six long slits down the middle, stopping the cut when the knife hits the tough peel. Run the knife down the other side of the avocado, sideways. You will essentially be creating small squares. Peel the avocado peel outward and back to expose the inside slices. Gently allow the slices to fall off the peel. If the avocado does not drop out of the peel on its own, gently run your knife underneath the fruit and between the peel to dislodge it. Add to the blender. Preparing the Fruit Peel and dice 1 small banana and add it to the blender.  Make fresh orange juice. Juice enough oranges to make 1 1/3 cups of freshly squeeze orange juice (roughly 4 to 6 medium sized oranges). Pour into the blender. Measure 1 ¼ cups of frozen fruit. Use fruit such as pineapple, blackberries, strawberries or even mixed berries. Add to the blender. Making the Smoothie Combine all of the above prepared ingredients in the blender. Blend at high speed. Avoid over-blending as you may break down some of the ingredients and flavor. Pour the drink into a tall glass. Top with a variety of ingredients such as ½ a lime squeezed over the top immediately before serving, 1 tablespoon of coconut milk drizzled over the top, or 2 teaspoons of unsweetened coconut flakes. For added kick, try a dash of cayenne pepper.
